Articles.Content: I have all the correct stuff set up, the landing pilot is set to deploy parachutes, but nothing happens and my kerbals die. Anyone know how to fix this?

I never use it because I don't trust it.  No reason not to just deploy them manually. 

But you are probably better off asking in the MJ thread. 

Edited July 10, 2018 by Gargamel
You're probably going too fast for them to open. You may want to try a less steep re-entry, or add a drogue chute.
Despite including a parachute option, I've found that the MJ landing autopilot isn't really designed to work in an atmosphere.

21 minutes ago, Capt. Hunt said:

Despite including a parachute option, I've found that the MJ landing autopilot isn't really designed to work in an atmosphere.

Exactly.   The best way to use it for "accurate" atmospheric landings, I have found, is to use the Trajectories Mod.  Burn till the projected landing site is on your target, and then re-enter as needed.  IF the vessel is still going too fast to land safely, use the MJ "land somewhere" feature to fire the retrorockets to soften the landing.
For atnospheric entry, i figured that the spaceX pack booster do quite good under the autoland function. Can often get to within 20m of the target if booster does not flip over.
